page.title: 05Great Barford House
page.content: Great Barford House is a large, imposing home for the Hughes family. The house was extended in the middle of the 19th.century and portraits of a previous owner,John Arnold and his wife hang in the dining room.The most striking feature is the water tower. Every day water is pumped up to the tower from the spring which flows towards the cellar. Mr.and Mrs.Hughes have started to restore the house and have faced problems with rising damp,woodworm and a very complicated heating system.Mrs. Hughes has modernised the kitchen but told us she "liked to live in the past"and so the other rooms have a Victorian atmosphere.Their home has a swimming pool,tennis court and extensive grounds.The house is a Listed Building.
